info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 4 at 10:29PM CDT until June 5 at 7:54PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
San Saba River At San Saba affecting San Saba County.
For the San Saba River...including San Saba...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...San Saba River at San Saba.
* WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 PM CDT Wednesday was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.5 feet on 06/19/1961. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued around 6PM.Thursday morning at 1030 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING
